content:
From: Johannes HÃ¶lzl <hoelzl@in.tum.de>
Hi Isabelle users & developers,

we have now a wiki for the Isabelle community:

http://isabelle.in.tum.de/community

It is intended for:

  • the lists which are always outdated, like
    - FAQ,
    - projects people working on,
    - theory collections,
    - external tools,
    - ...

    These lists will not automagically be better maintained because its
    a wiki. But, they are already outdated and having them in a wiki
    at least simplifies their maintenance.

  • managing pages for big changes like:
    https://isabelle.in.tum.de/community/Having_%27a_set_back

  • miscellaneous tips and tricks

The pages faq.html, community.html and projects.html are moved to the
wiki.

To edit the wiki pages you need an account, just write an email to
hoelzl@in.tum.de and I will create an wiki-account for you.

There are special interwiki links to reference the Isabelle repository
or the AFP, see
https://isabelle.in.tum.de/community/How_to_use_this_wiki

Old links like

https://isabelle.in.tum.de/isanotes/index.php/<page>

are now

https://isabelle.in.tum.de/community/<page>

The old links work, but they should not be used.

I hope you like it,
Johannes

From: Makarius <makarius@sketis.net>
Since Coq users are already ahead several years, one might benefit from
looking what they have at http://coq.inria.fr/cocorico

I've only clicked on the "Video Tutorials" link, to find that Andrej Bauer
pretends to download Proof General for Coq, but then runs Proof General
3.7.1.1 from the Isabelle distribution :-)

Makarius
